Articles.Content:
Greetings. Nfeld has made a satellite pack to compliment our company's probe selection. Here it is.

Downloads: https://www.dropbox.com/sh/d14bnluae4lez8w/kvb47I97g0

To download them all simply click on the gear in the upper right and download as .zip

This package, by Nfeld, includes the following:

-BluCom 1

The scientist at HQ managed to scrap this together and sell for a few bucks to the military.

-BluCom 2

Made after the military demanded a satellite with "pointy thingys and twice as much glue/chewed gum as BluCom 1 had."

-BluExperiment Omega

Feeling a need for "sciency-ness" the engineers decided to tape some instruments onto an old probe.

-BluExperiment Probe

Some engineers misread a blueprint for a chair and instead made a big satellite.

-BluStudy Probe

EDIT: the same as of the BE Omega, the BluStudy features more duct tape and was therefore three times as expensive because of "extreme durability".

-POP Polar Orbit Probe

The POP was first supposed to be an atomic bomb, commissioned by the military, until a heavy night of drinking caused...a change of plans.

-Taurus BluCom

Made for stealing ideas from a nearby space agency, the Taurus was designed for keostationary orbit.

-Taurus BluCom II

Originally for spying on other companies, but now works as a GPS satellite for kerbal truckers.

Bye guys, have a nice day...*yawn*

Edited June 27, 2013 by Kerbol Prime

Oops I forgot that that the BE Omega was the same as the BluStudy!

Thanks for posting Kerbol!
